meanings.sent1: She was misbelieving the weather forecast and didn't bring an umbrella.
meanings.sent2: He often misbelieves in superstitions and avoids walking under ladders.
meanings.sent3: The cat was misbelieving that the laser pointer was a real bug.
meanings.sent4: His misbelieving in his own abilities acted as a barrier to his success.
meanings.sent5: The misbelieving rumor spread like wildfire through the small town.

meanings.definition: To have a false or incorrect belief.
meanings.sent1: They were misbelieving the map and ended up getting lost.
meanings.sent2: She misbelieves that eating carrots will improve her eyesight overnight.
meanings.sent3: The misbelieving child thought that the tooth fairy would bring a new toy instead of money.
meanings.sent4: His misbelieving in magic potions led to disappointment when they didn't work.
meanings.sent5: The misbelieving theory was quickly debunked by scientific evidence.
